diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Complicated acute appendicitis with abscess formation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with worsening right lower quadrant pain, minor nausea, and decreased appetite, which led to the suspicion of appendicitis. The CT abdomen and pelvis revealed wall thickening and hyperemia of the cecum, consistent with appendicitis, and a loculated fluid collection adjacent to the cecum, indicating abscess formation.
